page.title: 19Changes in Twyford.
page.content: In 1920-1940 homes were much smaller than now with no hot water. They had an outside bathroom and a stable. Now houses are bigger with electric ovens,fridges and washing machines. Shops always had seats,they were small and more homely but with less things than now.At the present we have supermarkets such as {Asda,Waitrose } and {Sainsburys.} Schools were crowded and much smaller than now with about {45 children in {each class.}There were open fires, benches and the children worked with {Slate and Chalk}.Nowadays schools are large comprehensives with computers. The area was mainly fields with dirt_tracks for roads.{The A4 wasn't {built until 1930.}Transport was by bicycle,car or horse and cart.{ {
